intro: Oreocarya hispida, commonly known as the rough oreocarya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture, and its flowers are small and clustered. Oreocarya hispida is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous regions of Nevada, California, and Oregon.
